topics.body:
oh god

I was just mucking around with my application for the part-time job I submitted to yesterday, and I think I may have made a grave mistake with submitting my application:

_I forgot to answer a couple of questions asking me about my availability during the week on my cover letter, and I think I may have screwed over my chances for getting a position at all._

Unless somehow I can recover from that and save myself at say the job interview, or find a way to resubmit my application with a revised cover letter, I fear I may have just doomed myself to not get the job at all, or I've made it harder for them to evaluate me to see if I'm even qualified. 

_All because I just happened missed an important detail, or what I assume is an important detail._ Everything else is as correct and accurate as possible. I'm sure of that, most definitely.

-Now I'm frustrated, in addition to be really scared now.-

*TL;DR - I may have goofed up my job application, and now I'm either screwed, or there's still a chance left that I can recover from this and get the job somehow.*
topics.author: 536f7a11636872666e2d0000

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559064856368722f03000022#post_559064856368722f03000022
_Part-time concessions job at my college's fancy theatre auditorium._ Theatre's kinda of a bid deal over here, since we're going to have stuff like Wicked and the Book of Mormon playing there later this year.

This is a big deal for me because I've never had a paying job before, and I feel like I'm at that point where I'm probably want to have a job and definitely need to start working part-time if I'm going to be living off on my own once I'm done will my studies in college.

Just kind of want a head-start in life before life "screws me over" or takes me in a weird direction.
